title: Why did PUMA rebrand itself as PVMA ? - The Times of India
summary:
PUMA Rebrands as PVMA in Honor of PV Sindhu

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

PUMA India has undertaken a significant rebranding initiative, temporarily changing its signage to “PVMA” in celebration of its new collaboration with badminton champion PV Sindhu.

  • The rebranding symbolizes PUMA's official entry into badminton.
  • The campaign generated excitement online and involved changing signage in select stores across India.
  • A new badminton range will launch featuring high-performance products.
  • PV Sindhu joins an elite roster of PUMA athletes, including various sports stars and influencers.
  • 57 million fans of badminton are currently in India, with a growing interest among Gen Z.
  • Official debut of the collaboration is set for the India Open 2025.
“I hope to inspire others, especially women, to take risks, believe in themselves, and strive for greatness both on and off the court.” - PV Sindhu

This partnership not only enhances badminton’s profile in India but also aims to inspire a new generation of players through innovative sport initiatives.
newTitle: PUMA Rebrands as PVMA in Honor of PV Sindhu

title: Report: Man Utd striker wants to join Barcelona - English Premier League Index - Opta Stats
summary:
Report: Rashford Prioritises Barcelona Amid January Transfer Speculation

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Sport

Marcus Rashford has become a key target for Barcelona as they look to enhance their attacking options during the January transfer window. Rashford has expressed a desire to join Barcelona but has set a deadline of January 15 for the club's response regarding a potential loan.

  • Barcelona considering Rashford primarily as a loan option.
  • Hansi Flick supports the move, citing Rashford's versatility.
  • Concerns exist within Barcelona about Rashford's consistency and off-field issues.
  • Rashford's representatives are exploring other offers from AC Milan and Borussia Dortmund.
  • A meeting with Dortmund officials indicates interest but Rashford prefers a move to Barcelona.
“Rashford brings a dynamic edge to the game, and his skill set aligns with the demands of modern football.”

In conclusion, while Rashford’s potential transfer to Barcelona is steeped in hope for personal revival, it raises questions about Manchester United’s management of his talents and future implications for the club.
newTitle: Rashford Prioritizes Move to Barcelona Amid Transfer Speculation

title: Rift Between Gautam Gambhir And Morne Morkel After India Head Coach Scolded South African For Arriving Late - News18
Fabrizio Romano: 'Incredible' Man Utd Star is 'Dream' Signing for Euro Giants - GIVEMESPORT
summary:
Garnacho: A Dream Signing for Napoli?

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: GiveMeSport

The article discusses Alejandro Garnacho's fluctuating status at Manchester United and the interest from Napoli for a potential transfer.

  • Garnacho's inconsistent playtime under coach Ruben Amorim raises questions about his future.
  • He has performed well when given the chance, contributing to a recent FA Cup victory.
  • Rumors suggest Napoli views him as a replacement for Khvicha Kvaratskhelia, who may leave for PSG.
  • Fabrizio Romano highlights the high price tag United would set for Garnacho.
“He's kind of a dream signing for Napoli. He's a player they really appreciate internally.” - Fabrizio Romano

The interest from Napoli indicates that Garnacho's talent is recognized, but any transfer would have to align with the club's budget considerations.
newTitle: Garnacho: A Dream Signing for Napoli?

title: Titled Tuesday Sets Participation Record, Hikaru Joins 2025 Win Column - Chess.com
summary:
Titled Tuesday Sets Participation Record, Hikaru Joins 2025 Win Column

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Chess.com

The latest Titled Tuesday event attracted a record 905 participants, marking the highest turnout since June 2020. GM Arjun Erigaisi won the early tournament, while GM Hikaru Nakamura secured his first victory of 2025 in the late tournament.

  • The event saw GM Arjun Erigaisi score 10 points but needed tiebreaks to win against GM Hikaru Nakamura.
  • Nakamura finished with 9.5 points and won the late event, his first of the year.
  • Over 25,000 viewers watched the event live on Twitch/X.
“Over 25k watched on Twitch / X. @chesscom truly has the strongest tournament in the world TWICE every Tuesday!!” — Hikaru Nakamura

The Titled Tuesday series continues to draw significant participation and viewer engagement, highlighting its popularity within the chess community.
newTitle: Titled Tuesday Sets Participation Record, Hikaru Joins 2025 Win Column

title: Official: Chelsea activate option to recall Trevoh Chalobah from Crystal Palace - We Ain't Got No History
summary:
Chelsea Recalls Trevoh Chalobah from Crystal Palace

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Crystal Palace F.C.

Chelsea has officially activated the option to recall Trevoh Chalobah from his loan at Crystal Palace, which follows previous confusion regarding the terms of his loan.

We can confirm that Chelsea have activated an option to recall Trevoh Chalobah from his loan spell. We’d like to thank Trevoh for his hard work in red and blue and wish him all the best for the future. — Crystal Palace F.C.

Chalobah is expected to challenge for a first-team place at Chelsea for the rest of the season, though a permanent departure is anticipated by season's end.

This recall comes as Chelsea faces defensive issues due to injuries to key players.
newTitle: Chelsea Recalls Trevoh Chalobah from Crystal Palace

Dinesh Karthik showcased exceptional glovework during the SA20 league match, impressing fans and teammates alike.

  • Karthik executed an outstanding one-handed catch.
  • His performance is a highlight in his ongoing cricket career.

“It was an unforgettable moment that exemplifies Karthik's talent.”

Karthik continues to be a vital player and his performance adds excitement to the league.

title: BCCI mulling addition to India Men's coaching staff - Cricbuzz
Alejandro Garnacho 'transfer agreement reached' as Man Utd 'target £42m replacement' - Express
"Ban Indian players from having PR agencies": Harsha Bhogle suggests a new rule for Team India - Crictoday
summary:
“Ban Indian players from having PR agencies”: Harsha Bhogle suggests a new rule for Team India

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Crictoday

Harsha Bhogle, a renowned sports presenter, has suggested banning Indian cricket team members from having public relations (PR) agencies following recent changes introduced by the BCCI.

  • The BCCI has implemented various rules for players after a recent defeat against Australia, including restrictions on travel and family visits.
  • Bhogle believes that banning PR agencies would be beneficial for the integrity of the team.
  • He expressed his views on social media, raising concerns about the impact of PR agencies on player reputation.
“Reading of the changes the BCCI is apparently suggesting for the Indian team. I don't know how much to believe but if I had to nominate one rule to be strictly applied, it would be to ban team members from having PR agencies”— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) January 15, 2025

The presence of PR agencies is said to encourage the spread of misinformation about players and can lead to conflicts of interest.

In conclusion, Bhogle's call for banning PR agencies highlights ongoing concerns about their influence in cricket.
newTitle: Harsha Bhogle Advocates for New Rule Against PR Agencies for Indian Cricketers

title: Vijay Hazare Trophy: Padikkal, Shetty step up as Karnataka storm into final - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Karnataka Dominates Haryana to Reach Vijay Hazare Trophy Final

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Karnataka secured a convincing victory over Haryana by five wickets, thanks to stellar performances from Devdutt Padikkal and Abhilash Shetty, propelling them into the Vijay Hazare Trophy final for the first time since the 2019-20 season.

  • Karnataka scored 238 runs for 5 wickets, overcoming Haryana's 237 for 9.
  • Padikkal scored 86 runs and shared a crucial 128-run partnership with Ravichandran Smaran, who contributed 76 runs.
  • Shetty excelled with the ball, taking 4 wickets for 34 runs, significantly impacting Haryana's batting order.
  • Karnataka will face either Vidarbha or Maharashtra in the final.
'I’m amazed myself' - Karun Nair reflects on record-breaking run.

In summary, Karnataka showed resilience and skill, demonstrating their potential as they move forward in the tournament.
newTitle: Karnataka Dominates Haryana to Reach Vijay Hazare Trophy Final

title: Late Drama? Champions Trophy Captains' Meet, Opening Ceremony In Pakistan, ICC Told. Rohit Sharma's .. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Champions Trophy Captains' Meeting Scheduled for Pakistan Opening Ceremony

Publication Date: October 18, 2023 Source: NDTV

The opening ceremony for the Champions Trophy is set for February 16 or 17 in Pakistan, with hopes that Indian captain Rohit Sharma will attend despite India's matches being scheduled in Dubai due to security concerns.

  • The PCB is awaiting confirmation from the ICC regarding the captains' photo-shoot and press conference schedule.
  • The tournament begins on February 19 in Karachi.
  • The PCB has secured all necessary government clearances for visas for players and officials.
  • Indian nationals from the ICC delegation were issued visas promptly during their visit.
This obviously includes Rohit or any other Indian team player or official or board official.

The PCB emphasizes that the opening ceremony will be held in Pakistan, consistent with tournament protocols.
newTitle: Champions Trophy Captains' Meeting Scheduled for Pakistan Opening Ceremony

title: Pep Guardiola's wife 'called time on marriage after reaching final Man City decision' - The Mirror
summary:
Pep Guardiola's Wife 'Ended Marriage After Reaching Final Man City Decision'

Publication Date: 15:56, 15 Jan 2025

Source: Mirror

Pep Guardiola has separated from his wife, Cristina Serra, after 30 years together, influenced by his recent decision to extend his contract with Manchester City.

  • Guardiola signed a two-year contract extension in November, which reportedly strained their marriage.
  • His wife Cristina had relocated to Barcelona in 2019 for her fashion business.
  • Friends of the couple mentioned unusual behaviors suggesting tensions in their relationship.
  • The couple had previously spent Christmas together in Barcelona but decided on their future separately.
  • Lorena Vazquez and Laura Fa, respected reporters, stated there was no third party involved.
  • Guardiola's daughter emphasized their parents' focus on love and support in their family dynamics.
“The confirmation that Pep would stay at the Citizens until 2027 ended up breaking what was already cracked.”

This marital split highlights the personal sacrifices often involved in high-pressure careers, especially in the world of professional sports.
newTitle: Pep Guardiola's Marriage Ends After 30 Years Amid Contract Controversy

title: Top Xiangqi Grandmasters Banned For Life In Chinese Chess Scandal - Chess.com
summary:
Top Xiangqi Grandmasters Banned For Life In Chinese Chess Scandal

Publication Date: 2023-10-23
Source: Chess.com

A major cheating scandal has rocked the world of Chinese chess, leading to lifetime bans for several top players, including Wang Yuefei and Wang Tianyi.

  • A number of top Xiangqi players have received lifetime bans due to cheating scandals.
  • Wang Tianyi, a decorated player, is implicated in receiving bribes totaling 800,000 yuan.
  • The scandal became public after the Chinese Xiangqi Association issued bans in September.
  • Gai Hongyan stated that illegal activities have hindered the sport's development for over a decade.
  • 41 players have been penalized following a thorough investigation into match-fixing.

For over a decade, such illegal activities have been hampering the healthy development of the sport...

—Gai Hongyan

In conclusion, the extensive investigation uncovers a disturbing trend of corruption within the sport, threatening its integrity.
newTitle: Top Xiangqi Grandmasters Banned For Life In Chinese Chess Scandal

title: Haryana vs Karnataka LIVE Score, Vijay Hazare Trophy semifinal: KAR beats HAR by 5 wickets - Sportstar
Haryana vs Karnataka LIVE Score, Vijay Hazare Trophy semifinal: KAR beats HAR by 5 wickets - Sportstar
List of highest ODI team scores in women’s cricket: Where does India’s 435/5 figure - Sportstar
summary:
List of highest women’s ODI totals: India breaks into top five with 435/5 vs Ireland

Published: Jan 15, 2025 | Source: Team Sportstar

India has scored the highest-ever team total in women’s One-Day Internationals with 435/5 against Ireland in Rajkot. This score now ranks as the fourth-highest in women's ODI history.

  • There have only been six instances of 400+ scores in women's ODIs.
  • New Zealand holds the top three scores in the format.
  • Four of the six instances of 400+ scores have come against Ireland.

“India’s 435/5 is the fourth-highest score in the format.”

The achievement marks a significant milestone in women’s cricket, showcasing India’s growing prowess on the international stage.
newTitle: India Achieves Historic 435/5 Against Ireland in Women's ODI

title: Arundhati Reddy wants to be 'the best allrounder in the world' - ESPNcricinfo
Nortje ruled out of Champions Trophy with back injury - Cricbuzz
summary:
Anrich Nortje Out of Champions Trophy Due to Back Injury

Date: Wed, Jan 15, 2025

Source: Cricbuzz

Anrich Nortje has been ruled out of the Champions Trophy and the remainder of the SA20 tournament due to a back injury. His absence continues as scans revealed he is not expected to recover in time to participate.

  • Nortje was a highlight of South Africa's squad announcement but will miss the tournament starting February 21 against Afghanistan.
  • He has not played international cricket since June last year and last appeared on the field on December 2 during the Abu Dhabi T10.
  • Nortje opted out of the 2024/25 Test season to focus on his health and franchise career.
  • He faced a broken toe injury from a David Miller yorker in the nets recently.
  • This injury adds to his history of setbacks, including missing the 2019 and 2023 ODI World Cups.
  • Gerald Coetzee is expected to replace him in the team.
“Gerald Coetzee played very well in the 2023 World Cup... Anrich has more experience and attributes that will stand us in good stead in Pakistan.” - Rob Walter, South Africa's coach

Nortje's future participation in the IPL remains uncertain as he continues to recover from his injury.
newTitle: Anrich Nortje Out of Champions Trophy Due to Back Injury

title: Pant available for Delhi's next Ranji Trophy game, but DDCA 'haven't heard from Kohli' - ESPNcricinfo
Back injury rules Nortje out of Champions Trophy - ESPNcricinfo
Ihsanullah reverses decision to retire from all franchise cricket - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Ihsanullah Reverses Retirement Decision from Franchise Cricket

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Pakistan fast bowler Ihsanullah has changed his mind about retiring from franchise cricket less than a day after announcing it, citing emotional turmoil and a desire to prove himself.

  • Ihsanullah stated he made the initial retirement decision in an emotional state.
  • He emphasized his commitment to work hard for the upcoming PSL season.
  • Franchise owner Ali Tareen expressed concern for Ihsanullah's wellbeing and support during his recovery.
  • Independent reports criticized the PCB for their handling of Ihsanullah's elbow injury.
“I take my decision back. No franchise picked me, and the comments of a lot of people sent me over the edge.” - Ihsanullah

The fast bowler is determined to overcome his challenges and return to competitive cricket.
newTitle: Ihsanullah Reverses Retirement Decision from Franchise Cricket

title: "Shubman Gill Not In Captaincy Thoughts": Huge Blow To India Star As New Contenders Emerge - NDTV Sports
Champions Trophy Ticket Price: Higher In Dubai, Dirt Cheap In Pakistan At Rs... - NDTV Sports
summary:
Champions Trophy Ticket Price: Higher In Dubai, Dirt Cheap In Pakistan At Rs...

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: NDTV

The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has set the initial ticket prices for the Champions Trophy matches, revealing a significant price gap compared to Dubai where matches involving India will be held.

  • General enclosure tickets in Pakistan start at PKR 1000 (approximately INR 310), with increased pricing for higher-demand matches.
  • For the Pakistan vs. Bangladesh match in Rawalpindi, the ticket price escalates to PKR 2000 (INR 620).
  • VVIP ticket prices are set at PKR 12,000 (INR 3726) for all matches but rise to PKR 25,000 (INR 7764) for semi-finals.
  • The PCB expects to sell around 18,000 tickets for general spectators, but details on individual purchases remain unclear.
  • The ICC's decision to host matches in Dubai impacts revenue distribution for the PCB, which aims to collect gate money from those games.
“The ECB will obviously advise the ICC and PCB on the ticket rates for different enclosures in Dubai...”

Overall, the ticket prices reflect the PCB's strategy to make matches accessible while also navigating additional pressures from hosting events in neutral venues.
newTitle: Champions Trophy Ticket Prices: Major Discrepancy Between Dubai and Pakistan

title: India squads for Champions Trophy, England ODIs LIVE Updates: Will Rohit Sharma travel to Pakistan for CT? - Firstpost
summary:
India squads for England ODI series and Champions Trophy Highlights

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Firstpost

The BCCI is expected to announce the Team India squad for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy in the coming days. While Rohit Sharma looks set to lead and Virat Kohli will also feature, India are sweating over the fitness of pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who sustained a back spasm during the fifth Test against Australia.

Key Points

  • Team India will play all matches for the ICC Champions Trophy in Dubai; they will not travel to Pakistan.
  • The squad announcement is expected around January 18 or 19.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's fitness concerns may impact squad selection.
  • The opening match for India against Bangladesh is scheduled for February 20, followed by a crucial match against Pakistan.

Notable Quotes

“Pakistan will have the upper hand against India... However, India has always been my favourite in big tournaments.” - Mohammad Amir

Conclusion

The anticipation builds around the finalization of India's squad as they gear up for significant matches in the ICC Champions Trophy and the series against England.
newTitle: India's Squad Announcement for Champions Trophy and England ODIs Expected Soon

title: Cristiano Ronaldo to become co-owner of Al Nassr with new contract extension: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Cristiano Ronaldo to become co-owner of Al Nassr with new contract extension: Report

Jan 15, 2025 | Hindustan Times

Cristiano Ronaldo is close to signing a new deal with Al Nassr, which will extend his stay and provide him a small ownership stake in the club.

  • Ronaldo will receive 5% ownership as part of his new contract.
  • The deal represents a long-term association for Ronaldo with the club.
  • Ronaldo is determined to win more titles despite competition from top teams.
  • He has expressed satisfaction with his life in Saudi Arabia.
“I’m happy and my family is happy. We started a new life in this beautiful country.”

Ronaldo aims to improve upon his performance at Al Nassr and contribute to the club's success.
newTitle: Cristiano Ronaldo to become co-owner of Al Nassr with new contract extension: Report

title: Ruben Amorim fires Liverpool and Arsenal warning to Man Utd stars ahead of Southampton clash - The Mirror
India’s Arjun Erigaisi defeats Magnus Carlsen, Fabiano Caruana to win online chess event - Mint
summary:
India’s Arjun Erigaisi defeats Magnus Carlsen, Fabiano Caruana to win online chess event

Publication Date: Tuesday, Source: First Post

Indian grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi won the Titled Tuesday weekly blitz competition on Chess.com, defeating World No 1 Magnus Carlsen and World No 2 Fabiano Caruana.

  • Erigaisi scored 10 points from 11 rounds in the competition.
  • He defeated Carlsen in round 10 and Caruana in the final round.
  • Erigaisi is ranked fourth in the world, while Hikaru Nakamura is third.
  • The event hosted over 900 participants and required players to attend Zoom calls for fair play.
“Nakamura has claimed to be the 'world’s strongest tournament'.”

Arjun Erigaisi's journey in chess has been remarkable, leading to multiple prestigious wins including the Tata Steel Chess 2022 Challengers and the 2024 WR Chess Masters Cup.
newTitle: Arjun Erigaisi Triumphs Over Chess Giants Magnus Carlsen and Fabiano Caruana

title: BCCI says no to KL Rahul and Sanju Samson for Champions Trophy; Rishabh Pant, Jurel set to be India's keepers: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
BCCI Excludes KL Rahul and Sanju Samson for Champions Trophy; Rishabh Pant and Dhruv Jurel Set as Keepers

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The BCCI has reportedly excluded KL Rahul and Sanju Samson from consideration for the wicketkeeper positions in India's Champions Trophy squad. Rishabh Pant and Dhruv Jurel are expected to take on the roles of wicketkeepers.

  • Samson's absence from the Vijay Hazare Trophy preparatory camp may have jeopardized his chances.
  • KL Rahul is no longer considered for the specialist keeper's role in ODIs.
  • Rishabh Pant is firmly established as the first-choice wicketkeeper.
  • Dhruv Jurel is emerging as the potential second keeper despite competition from Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan.
  • Samson has missed recent opportunities, impacting his selection for future tournaments.
"KL Rahul's presence behind the stumps during the ODI World Cup gave the Indian team the balance but the stylish Karnataka right-hander is unlikely to don the big gloves in white-ball cricket going forward."

The BCCI's decisions reflect a growing emphasis on player commitment to domestic competitions and suggest that the team is evolving as it prepares for the Champions Trophy.
newTitle: BCCI Excludes KL Rahul and Sanju Samson for Champions Trophy; Rishabh Pant and Dhruv Jurel Set as Keepers
